item.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Lancashire, in the United Kingdom.
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Leicestershire, in the United Kingdom.

The great property trading game finds its home in the heart of the North West. You can now play this classic game with the street names, landmarks and locations that give the city its distictive character. With its exciting, cosmopolitan atmosphere, galleries, theatres, Victorian architecture and sports clubs, Manchester is the liveliest of cities. Its comprehensive travel links will speed you around from Old Trafford to Granada Studios, the Museum of Science and Industry and, bustling Chinatown. As the hub of the North West, Manchester provides easy access to the moor and lake lands with Towns and Villages bursting with character. All of which makes for a fascinating edition of the world's favourite board game.

name.value: Monopoly: Liverpool Football Club Champions Of Europe

item.description: The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Liverpool edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from Liverpool's illustrious past and two of the club's greatest managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Liverpool fans!

The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Manchester United edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from United's glorious past and two of football's greatest ever managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Reds fans!
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Middlesbrough, in the United Kingdom.
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Newcastle & Gateshead, in the United Kingdom.

The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Newcastle United edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from Newcastle's illustrious past and two of the club's greatest managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Newcastle fans!

Thunderbirds to the rescue with 6 collectable die-cast vehicles! Complete with Evil Hood mover for optional play.
Join the Tracy family, Lady Penelope and all your other favourites. Race around the board on an International Rescue mission. Buy and sell vehicles, characters and locations. For extra fun you can add the special Evil Hood gameplay. Stay cool under pressure – may the richest player win!

The classic Monopoly with elements from the University Of Leeds, in the United Kingdom.

POCKET-SIZE GOLF is an ideal size game to carry along wherever you go, to get in 18 holes of Golf while in the auto, in a boat, on an airplane, at home in the living room, or in bed.

Basically take turns turning over a card and moving your marker down the fairway.

This is a ship-to-ship combat game that was published as an expansion to the AD&D campaign setting Spelljammer. The game is set in outer space, but the ships and rules are much like you'd expect in a traditional naval combat game like Wooden Ships & Iron Men. The added dimension is that ships generally come with mages that can fire off many spells. Rules are included for ramming, boarding, over 25 types of missile and small arms weapons, and lots of magic.

Components include rules for ship-to-ship combat, two large hex maps, and over 30 cardboard punch-out ships.

link.value: From RPG books to board games

item.description: From the publisher: "Ring in the fun when you grab your mallet and give the mole a whack! Be quick and see if you can send this furry friend scurrying up-up-up the tower. WHAC-A-MOLE TOWER will keep kids entertained for hours! Four different games: HAMMER TIME: Race the clock to light the lights and ring the bell; LIGHTS OUT: Race to turn off the lights!; HIT 100: Be the first to get 100 points; 0-60: a head to head battle to be the first to win 60 points. Included with the game is a lightweight mallet, perfect for kid’s hands to grip."

item.description:
The hospital personnel of the Schwarzwaldklinik (Black Forest Hospital - a TV-show from the 80's) is charged with trying to treat and make healthy the supplied patients (randomly drawn) as quickly as possible. After each visit, i.e. with each visit (after dice rolling and the moving of the meeple of a player located at the bed of the patient, a playing piece is set on one of the circles (2, 3 or 4) of the patient's card. Rolling a 6 results in reading and obeying some tasks on a randomly drawn event-card. The player, who provides the last playing piece for the individual patient's card, has cured the patient and gets his card.
The player with the most patient's cards wins.

Here's your chance to show how much knowledge you have in the sport you love. It doesn't matter if you're a beginner or a Tour player, this game is exciting and fun for all. Play the course and impress your friends as you collect Bonus Points and set a new course record! Expect grudging admiration from your opponents as you answer questions. Over 2,400 golf related questions and answers will help you and your friends increase your knowledge and appreciation for this greatest of games.

Plays like real golf, with the object of this game is to shoot the lowest score for the round. Play the course and collect Bonus Points and set a new course record!
Win Bonus Points along the way as you correctly answer questions . More questions are then asked upon reaching the green, and your total score for the hole is recorded on a scorecard. Sound easy? It is, if you can avoid water hazards, out-of-bounds and bunkers!

Includes Game Board, four player pieces, over 2,400 trivia questions, eight Mulligan cards, die, pencil and scorecards.

"Under Cross and Crescent" is a game about the struggle of empires in the middle ages.
Religion, politics, trade, assassination and crusades as well as jihads are a part of this game.
Your Empire will give birth to new heirs to the throne and send out priests to become pope, or 
if your nation is Islamic, you may launch a jihad against the catholic nations.
It´s all up to you to lead your nation to great power and wealth until the Mongol hordes invade.

This game features a new multi - purpose card system and the "Rondell - mechanism" from 
Mac Gerdts games "Antike" and "Imperial".

( If this game doesn't find a publisher until the end of 2007 it will be available for free print & play )

(from the publisher:)

During a war that blazed across most of the world, there was only one place in North America that was invaded and occupied by the Axis. The hard fighting that took place in the freezing fog and the logistical nightmare of getting there in the first place doesn't get the place in the history of the Second World War that it deserves.

This game is a strategic simulation of the fighting in the Aleutians between Japan and the United States from June 1942 to August 1943.

Most game turns represent one month of real time. Winter turns represent two months. 
 Contents: two 11 x 17-inch game maps, 247 counters that have to be mounted and cut-out, charts and tables, English rules

Earth is in trouble, and it is up to the players to explore space and find a suitable planet for colonization, as well as bringing back food and energy sources for use back on Earth. Part of the Family Pastimes cooperative game series.

From the box: "An Adventure Game For All Those Who Dare To Enter The Taetsequama Jungle"

Jungle Craze is a roll the dice and move along the path board game. Instead of a simple path, however, the path crosses and intersects, often giving the adventurer choices, but sometimes forcing the adventurer into an undesirable path. Adventurers collect survival gear, hire guides, deal with natives, and of course, challenge Taetsequama. To win, they must steal the treasure from the native temple and then return to the start area. However, once the treasure has been stolen from the temple, other players can steal the treasure by landing on the adventurer carrying it.

The instructions list three levels of play which add complexity for higher levels. Some of the challenges involve rolling specific numbers on the dice -- "Snake Eyes must be rolled within 10 tries." Some issues are decided based on the player's life experiences -- "If you've seen 'Dumbo', go to the south elephant walk. If not, go to the north elephant walk."

name.value: Some Poles Apart: The Battle of the Westerplatte

item.description:
Some Poles Apart is the second game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc., released to promote Against the Odds.

Some Poles Apart takes a close look at a fascinating and almost unknown action from the opening days of WWII, when a small group of Polish troops earned full "Honors of War" from the Nazis for an amazing defensive stand they made in a Polish military storehouse on Westerplatte, a peninsula in the then Free City of GdaÅ„sk.

item.description: This Shogi variant was invented (or, perhaps, rediscovered) by Shigeo Kusumoto in 1970. It is played on a 5x5 board and features pieces from standard shogi (king, gold, silver, bishop, rook, pawn). Pieces promote on the final rank. It also makes use of the standard shogi drop rule. Although played on a small board, mini shogi has not been solved, and it can serve as a simple introduction to shogi.

item.description:
From the back of the box:

Hook Line & Sinker is an easy to play, fun game that will entertain the entire family and you don't have to be a fisherman to enjoy playing Hook Line and Sinker. It is a game of chance that depicts most aspects of a day's fishing in a boat. In the box are 82 colorful playing cards representing ten varieties of fish. Each fish is worth a set amount of points from the low scoring Garfish to the mighty Marlin which can score you 100 points. Every cast of the dice will put you in an hilarious and exciting fishing predicament. The winner is the person who catches the most amount of fish with the highest points score, which means you can finish last around the board and still win the game. Try fishing in the lounge room, it's sure to get you in, Hook Line and Sinker.

item.description:
The Dolphin Training Game... The title says it all.
Teach your dolphins many tricks like a Tail-walk or a goodbye wave and become the best dolphin-trainer of the bunch.

The game is based on and uses actual dolphin names from the Dolphin Academy in Curacao. The game is actually a trivia game for the most part with over 200 cards with questions and assignments.

The action takes place on a board representing the island of Curacao, home base of the Academy, and features several basins where you can teach your dolphins new tricks and collect fish.

There's a little extra for (beginner) puzzle fans: The board is divided in 13 pieces, with a large dolphin-picture on the back, making the game also usable as an old fashioned puzzle.

The ideal family game for 2 to 4 players and also playable solo for hours and hours of fun.

A contest of both word and strategy where the object of the game is to create words and word structures before other players.

Suitable for players Ages 7 and up.

It allows players of varying abilities to be suitably challenged whilst playing the same game.

Usually played between 2 to 4 players, Word Wrangles can also be played solo. A game can take 10 minutes or go on for several hours.

item.description:
Survival of the Fittest is a fanboy retelling of the Battle Royale saga. In the game, a class of international students are ferried over to a deserted island by a teacher on a field trip. Unfortunately for them, the teacher is a big fan of the novel "Battle Royale". Once the students awake on the island, their biggest fears are realized: There is only one way off the island - to be the last one standing. Kill or be killed, true survival of the fittest.

Intended as a party game, Survival of the Fittest mixes together hand-management and bluffing of Bang! with the second guessing and alliances of Werewolf, bringing in up to 12 players to play as twelve of the fourteen unique characters which are dealt out randomly (along with a starting weapon) to the players.

Each turn the players secretly (or openly!) choose one of the twelve map co-ordinates to go to that turn, each space giving different advantages (an extra health, a new melee weapon). However, once there, it's time for action! Players ally together to take down other players before turning on their friends. Killing an opponent allows the player to take the weapon, strengthening their own position and in turn making themselves more of a target. However, hiding like a coward is an acceptable tactic, as players can only attack others in the same co-ordinate. With plenty of meta-gaming and whispering going around the table, you can never be sure who to trust!

As the game goes on, co-ordinates get randomly taken out of play to close down the areas and force confrontation until only one player remains - the fittest, the survivor.

Designed by Luke Morris and published by Games On The Way, Survival Of The Fittest aims to push itself head first into the big group and party game genre.

The Candy Land DVD game brings new excitement to the classic board game, with music, animation, and several classic characters brought to the TV screen. This game is for 2-4 players of Ages 3 - 6 - it includes one DVD, 20 gingerbread tokens and 24 floor mats.

There are three separate games and some music videos. "King Candy’s Adventure Game" is a color-matching game with movement similar to the board game; "Mr. Mint Says" is a game of following directions (like Simon Says); and the Grandma Nut game is a themed version of musical chairs. Youngsters will get up and move around as they try to perform the various tasks and collect gingerbread tokens.

It is the turn of the nineteenth century, and mad scientists throughout Europe are competing for the infamy of being the first to create life through the power of alchemy. Using only the raw materials provided by some dubious "Suppliers to the Anatomical Trade", harnessed lightning, and the services of a motley crew of unattractive servants, in It's Alive! you race to collect the eight body parts needed to create your monster and bring it to life. Unfortunately, the local peasants are particularly clumsy and tend to die in freak farming accidents, so the dubious gentlemen rarely find a whole cadaver in sufficiently good condition. Instead, they offer the parts they have managed to salvage. Each turn, you may buy the offered part, sell it to an anatomist for a meager profit, or auction it, trying to get a better deal or rip off your opponents. You might be lucky and get a coffin with a weakling clerk's cadaver in it, which can be used in lieu of any strapping villager's body part, or your involvement in the macabre trade might invoke the villagers' wrath.

Reimplements (and reimplemented by)


 The Menorah Game

item.description: The idea of the game is to create the family tree of a family together. Players get help from pictures of the members of family that have differing borders and background colors. With this information you are able to see how the genes transfer from generation to generation. In each family there are five generations and the player that first gets rid of his cards is the winner. The Finnish name of the game, Potretti, is an older word for a photo and refers to the pictures of the family members.

Players place ladder and girder cards in a particular pattern on the playing field starting from a girder strip to build a high-rise structure up to Donkey Kong who sits on his cardboard throne. Each time a card is played, the player moves their respective Mario pawn by die count up the card structure.

In addition to the plain ladder and girder cards are obstacle and remedy cards that are self-explanatory. If you're the first player to move your pawn up, above the highest girder where Donkey Kong sits, then you'll capture Donkey Kong and win the game. Oh joy!

The Gothic Line campaign game pits the Allied forces in Northern Italy against German forces desperate to hold the last line of mountains before the Allied forces enter Austria. The German must be very skilled at knowing when to hold and when to run. Delay the Allies long enough and you win.

A children's card game. The object of the game is simple enough get 5 cards of the same color or the same animal and you win the round. Win two rounds and you win the game.

The cards feature a monkey, tiger, panda, raccoon, and a mole each wearing blue, yellow, pink, green, and purple shirts. The artwork is simple and appealing to children.

Ages 6 - 10

The Golden Egg is a childrens' card game set in a traditional farmyard. Players start with a number of tokens and receive a set of cards face down. On their turn a player turns over the top most card from their deck and performs the action written there. This may involve paying tokens into the pool, receiving tokens from the pool, or paying or receiving tokens from the holders of other cards.
When a player turns up an egg card they pay one token into the pool and take the golden egg card irrespective of whether it is still in the middle or held by another player. When the golden goose is turned up the holder of the golden egg wins the pool.
The game can continue a pre-determined number of rounds or until all bar one player are bankrupt.

item.description: Monopoly edition using Los Angeles attractions in place of the normal street names. (Dodger Stadium and the Memorial Colisseum are Park Place and Boardwalk, for example)

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The University of Oregon version of Late for the Sky's series of college themed Monopoly clones.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Unofficial Monopoly clone (with a circular board) using locations related to the 1984 Olympics.

item.description:
Each player in turn must play a suitable card face-up on the discard pile in the center of the table. A card is suitable if it shows the same animal, or has the same color, as the top card of the discard pile.

The player who first manages to get rid of all his cards wins this round and may put his game piece forward one space on the game board. The game is played over several rounds; the player whose piece first reaches the final space on the game board wins the game.

The object of the game is: to "build" larger and larger houses, changing them from one size to the next. The Player first to complete the final House is the winner. You draw cards in turn and collect or return to the pool - bricks, windows, doors, etc. - as the cards direct. When you think you have all the parts you need, you "Build", but take care and act quickly, or you "Bust".

A different game than Blockhead!, Super Blockhead! includes 30 oddly-shaped wooden pieces and a cardboard base. Players take turns choosing a block to place on the tower, in "any position on any block," somewhat different from the original game.

Players get two chances to allow the tower to tumble; the third time results in being out of the game.

From the Publisher's website:


Computerama is a wacky family computer board game for two to six players, ages 8 to adult. This game combines many exciting features of other well known, and successful games all into one fun-filled event. Is it a Poker game? A Bingo game? Or a Word game? Yes, yes and yes! It’s all those and so much more.

Players are dealt Computerama Cards to start the game. The first player to finish their three cards and get to the Finish space wins the game.

Be careful of the many challenges that can confront you during this game. Don’t get caught between a “Rock, Paper, and Scissors.” Also always know when to “TIC, TAC, or TOE.”

Swedish trivia game with 250 questions about the Eurovision Song Contest.

The questions come in 5 different categories:
1. Winners
2. Lyrics
3. Costumes and Show
4. About the Contest
5. Losers

Box Contents:
- 50 cards with 5 questions each
- 1 card with rules
- 1 card with copyright and disclaimer

Draw travel tickets or postcards and use the travel spinner (by air, sea or land) to visit the countries drawn. The first player to visit all their countries and get back to their starting point wins.

The tickets name countries, the postcards name a county's capital and shows a scene from that country.

Teaches familiarity with the world map, country locations and national capitals.

4 games are described. One using tickets to show destinations, one using postcards for destinations, a "pairs" style of game, and postcard/flash card quiz.

Ages 5 and up

For the preparatory school - recognize colors

Putting play around recognizing color successions

The players set alternating Farbkarten on the queue. Everyone tries to put the color sequences which are shown on the small cards lying before it. There it means watched out! The queue will look ever longer and all players strained, which colors to line up gradually together.

The name of the game translates to "My first traffic school".

Fast perception and reaction are needed in order to play this game which deals with road safety training for children.

The game comes with, among other things, four thrill whistles and a very beautifully illustrated solution poster With the addition of four play variants "Meine erste Verkehrs-Schule ----SCOUT - my first traffic school" helps children Ages 5 and up deal with situations involving being around traffic. Players discover what is the right or wrong behavior while being near or in traffic. Those conditions are described on "small traffic condition cards". In addition children become acquainted with the meanings of many road signs.

Contents: 1 small plastic car, 1 small plastic horn, 34 situation small cards, 14 small road sign cards, 14 pasteboard traffic signs, 1 solution poster, 1 rule book

Themed around a horse race, players place bets before a wheel is spun and the result determined and bets paid out.

The game has been described as a themed version of Roulette with less betting options.

Which animal neighs, has a long mane, and wears shoes?

One player describes or imitates an animal, and the others try to guess which animal it is. When they have guessed, they must select the correct bottom from the animal cards on the table.

There are two game variants: 

 for age three: an older games master describes the animal and the younger players trying to grab it off the table
 for age four and up: players take it in turns to draw one of the small animal counters and describe the animal to other players. if they succeed both the describer and the guesser get a point.

item.description: 2-4 four players move their pieces around concentric circles and towards the center spot. Moves can be sliding one space around a circle, or jumping over another piece towards the center. Players get points by capturing (landing on) an opponents piece, or by "rescuing" (landing on) their own piece in the center.

From the box:

"Careful! Careful! You never know,
The one you add may make it blow!"

A spinner is used to determine how many marbles each player in turn must drop in a hat that sits on top of a balloon-man's head. Small strips with a texture resembling extremely rough sandpaper are attached under the hat; these sit gently on the surface of the balloon-head. At some point, the weight of the marbles becomes too much and the hat-strips pop the balloon. The winner is the person with the fewest marbles in their posession when the balloon bursts.

The game was designed by the well-known Marvin Glass & Associates design studio.

name.value: Skull & Bones: A World of Pirates

item.description:
A mixture of history and myth, Skull & Bones: A World of Pirates is the new strategy board game from the history geeks who brought you the acclaimed Galactic Destiny.

2-6 players are the Captains of a crew of pirate scum! Travel the seas with an innovative knot system, raid ports, cargo fleets and other pirates.

Pillage, raid and gain renown: Fame, Fear, Fortune -- who will be the most dreaded dog of the sea. Includes exciting rules for in game gambling!

Smallville is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorised, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

"Agents of the evil Kryptonian known as Zod have arrived on Earth and have disguised themselves as Kal-El of Krypton, who goes by the identity of Clark Kent. The agents of Zod each want to convince Clark Kent’s friends and family that THEY are the real Clark. In doing this the agents of Zod can banish the real Clark (Kal-El) and with him gone, the Earth will be theirs"

In this FREE 'Print and Play' board game players will battle villains to save their friends and earn valuable respect points.

All the files you need to play are available on the NEW and improved website below.

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

name.value: The Very Quiet Cricket Board Game

item.description:
For 2 - 4 players Ages 3 and up.

The Very Quiet Cricket Board Game is a spin and move game based on the Eric Carle book "The Very Quiet Cricket". Players start as newly hatched crickets and move from leaf to leaf in a journey to meet new friends and find their voice. Children learn about persistence, individuality, growth and love in this colorful game. Includes game board, 4 cricket game pieces, 24 insect cards, spinner and instructions. 2 to 4 Players.

from the games website:

FamilyLore, a new board game that centers around the players’ family history, genealogy, ancestors and traditions, encourages families to bond and share stories together … so every player is a winner.

FamilyLore Game is a unique board game for YOUR family. Unique because the game changes and grows as your family plays. FamilyLore Game is based on themes familiar to all families--and to other groups that have a shared history.

Players move around the board by answering questions about the family. These questions are organized around 20 themes.

Of the 600 Story Cards that are part of the game, 300 have questions to help you get underway. The remaining Story Cards provide players with a chance to write questions unique to them.

Serendipity spaces are at each corner of the board. When a player lands on one, s/he takes a Serendipity Card and follows its directions.

The first player to complete five trips around the board wins the game. Except, this is a game where everyone who plays wins because every player gets to tell his or her favorite family stories.

Napoleonic Quick March is an army level command game with corps and divisions as the major maneuver elements. Players dice for initiative order, draw command cards that act as division and corps commander interpretations of battle orders. Each player moves divisions in an attempt to affect a combined arms attack.

Novelty is the grid movement system where the board is divided into a point grid system. It allows complex maneuver similar to standard "measure and move" miniature games, but needs no rulers. Allows for more dynamic play than hexagonal grids with eight possible positions rather than six.

Major battles of the era can be played rather quickly, and a small number of troops are needed. It is an excellent game for beginners to get into the era, and it has enough complexity to keep veteran gamers interested.

The rules are full color, brief, well written, and easy to follow. Rule book includes a sample scenario in the back along with scenario building guide and open gaming army development matrix. Rules include basic and advanced rules, command cards, and quirky illustrations that bring a smile.

Bottom line is game is fast and entertaining.

Made by ERH in 1985 for 2-4 single players or any combination of teams.

Features 1000 Beach and Shag music questions!

OBJECT: Test your knowledge of Beach Music with this exciting game. It provides hours of fun as players try to answer question while avoiding such hazards as hang over, high tide, and too much sun. The first player to reach the condo and correctly answer a question wins!

Contents include: 250 cards, 4 pawns, 1 die, game board, and the cardboard insert.

From the Publisher:

"For the last 72 years, cycle tourists from all over the world have covered the PARIS-BREST-PARIS cross country cycle ride, 1200 Km to be run in less than 90 hours, passing through forests, towns and villages of 9 Districts. This is what the organizers of this exceptional meeting offer you: the opportunity to participate in the official PARIS-BREST-PARIS-Randonneur board game.

The objective is to be the player who achieves the best time in completing the PARIS-BREST-PARIS circuit, a journey consisting of some 1200 Km (750 miles). The player is expected to avoid the many pitfalls of the route, to arrive at control points within the required time, to achieve a good average time, to not waste time at controls points and to persevere despite the sometimes adverse weather conditions and other hazards which will get in their way!

A second objective of the game is to see which players can get all of their team past the finish line in Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines intact.

The game is played in two sequences: 1) The practice Lap at St. Quentin-en-Yvelines, 2) The Paris-Brest-Paris-Randonneur."

Made by World-Opoly in 1990 for 2 or more players ages 7 and up.

A community spirit game, custom designed to create the unique character of Columbus.

OBJECT: Players enter the game as visitors to Columbus. As players travel around the board, they have the opportunity to buy, sell, and trade properties. The winner has the opportunity to stay as a resident, while the others must pack their bags and leave town.

COMPLETE contents include: game board, 2 dice, 4 pawns, business license cards, sunny money, surprise cards, treasure chest cards, branches and corporate offices, and the instructions printed on the insert.

The Battle of Reichshoffen, also known as Froeschwiller or Woerth, was one of France's early disasters in the disastrous Franco-Prussian War. It is most notable for a desperate and futile charge by the French cuirassiers and for a children's song that begins C'était au soir d'la bataille de Reichshoffen.

The scale of Reichshoffen 1870 is the same as Solferino 1859 (600 meters/hex, 1 hour/turn, units are brigades). The rules vary only slightly: French defensive fire and Prussian artillery are both more effective than in the earlier game, reflecting the two nations' technical advances in small arms and cannon, respectively. French heavy cavalry have two opportunities per game for a charge à la mort, which can strike anywhere within five hexes of a French headquarters - usually without effect but useful if saved for just the right opportune moment.

Other rules changes are based on the armies' command problems. The French army has no commander-in-chief. Marshal Mac Mahon, the hero of the Battle of Magenta, "although physically present on the battlefield did not direct the battle". As a consequence, French formations can act effectively only by passing initiative tests. (Optional rules give the Marshal a chance to be slightly or fully effective.) On the Prussian side, there was quite a lot of initial confusion; brigades cannot launch coordinated attacks until the commander-in-chief, Prince Frederick William, arrives on the scene halfway through the action.

The battle begins at 8:30 am and lasts for 10 hourly turns. The victory conditions are simple: The Prussians must occupy four villages in the center of the map; otherwise the French win. The map is slightly less than half the old Vae Victis standard, sharing a sheet with the one for Magenta 1859. The counters must be mounted and cut apart.

link.value: Les Grandes Batailles de Napoleon III

item.description:
The Battle of Magenta, June 4, 1859, was the first major clash between France and Austria during the Second Italian War of Independence. Magenta 1859 recreates it using the same rules as Solferino 1859 and Reichshoffen 1870, as well as the same scale (one hour per turn, 600 meters per hex, brigades). Unlike its siblings, the game has almost no special rules.

Napoleon III commands the French and, though scarcely comparable to his uncle, well overmatches the Austrians' sluggish and late arriving Count Gyulai. Unfortunately for the French, Napoleon enters far away from the bulk of his forces and takes a long time to get within command range. Until then, formations may move effectively only when their commanders make successful initiative rolls, and the largest French corps suffers from an initiative penalty for the first several hours. (Its commander, General Mac Mahon, moved slowly while waiting for a Sardinian division to come up to cover his open flank. This caution did not, however, prevent him from becoming the hero of the day. The Emperor rewarded him with the title "duc de Magenta".)

The battle starts at 10:00 a.m. and lasts 10 turns, with many brigades not arriving until the afternoon. The forces (and the map) are only about half the size of those in Solferino, and the victory conditions are simpler: Each side gets one Victory Point for each hex it holds in the town of Magenta (which has three) plus one for each demoralized enemy corps.

item.description:
Made by Milton Bradley in 1961 for Ages 4 - 8.

Have fun. Dial each word letter by letter, arrow points to matching letter. Learn to spell 99 words!

Contents are: cardboard insert, spinner/dialer and extra cards (5 double sided).

From the publisher's Website:

Luft Krieg is a tabletop air combat wargame set in an alternate world where the wonders of pulp science-fiction magazines are realities of science. Players take the part of commanders guiding their daring aces through aerial battles inspired by the Second World War. This book includes basic rules and counters to take control of the air forces of any one of five powerful nations to help decide the fate of the Free World.

Luft Krieg uses the same system as the Gear Krieg Wargame.

Destination Paris is an award winning souvenir game. From the back of the box:
DESTINATION is the award winning fast moving Taxi game that will take you on a journey through the streets of Paris in your very own cab!
As the driver you will visit famous destinations in the city, collecting fares and trying to avoid the traffic lights. You must not run out of fuel, or lose your license and be careful not to upgrade to a Turbo Taxi too quickly as you could run out of cash and may need a logbook loan to bail you out!
The aim of this game is to be the player with the highest earnings... if you survive the shift!

Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden is a trivia game focusing on German topography. Players draw cards describing towns, popular sights or landmarks, etc. and are then asked to pinpoint them on the game board which is a map of Germany. However, no place names are included on the map.

The map is divided into several zones of varying sizes. Players can try to gain more points by choosing a smaller (thus more concrete) zone, or play it safe, by only choosing a general area (larger zone) for the location in question.

item.description:
A Miniature Combat System based on the Terminator storyline.
Humans fight machines in the desolate landscapes of future earth.

Featuring the best-selling comic character Asterix, this is an interesting riff on choose your own path books. Rather than just work through the choices in the book, the player is using the book and attempting to transverse a map. Another difference from typical choose your own path games, the player can gain and use a number of cards, like magic potions and a coin bag. In addition, some of the paths available are determined by a die roll.

The game comes with a die featuring many of the Asterix characters. In addition, the game comes with a clever cipher and code breaking card. One more difference between typical choose your own path books, this one is a weighty 284 pages.

From the cover, "Use your skill to help Asterix outwit the Romans - before his magic potions run out!"

item.description:
The video board game featuring Mickey, Donald, and friends. With actual footage from Disney’s animated classic cartoons. There are three games that can be played, Mickey’s Bingo, Feeling Ducky, and Every Which Way.

Made by Milton Bradley in 1986 for 1-3 players Ages 3 - 6.

Contents include: VHS tape, 3 two-sided game boards, 48 character tokens, 2 decks of 30 cards, 1 deck of 24 cards, cardboard insert, and the instructions.

A tactical game with black and white wooden chips players try to collect.

In the beginning, in front of each player lies as a row of mixed up black and white chips. According to different "formulas" printed on cards, players may trade a row of chips (e.g. black-white-white-black) for a different set (e.g. black-black-black). When a formula card is used it is discarded and a new one is drawn. 
Making skillful use of the "currency" allows players to change chips as long as they end up having collected chips of only one color - they win!

name.value: The Land Before Time: Escape from Red Claw Game

item.description: Based on Cartoon Network’s “The Land Before Time” TV series, this board game allows players to role play as their favorite dinosaur characters: Littlefoot, Ducky, Cera, Chomper and Red Claw. Littlefoot and his friends are trying to get to the Great Valley, but Red Claw tries to keep them back. The first player who reaches the Great Valley wins.

Chaotic is a collectible trading card game in the similar vein as the popular game Yu-Gi-Oh.

The game allows 2 players to use fantastic creatures to battle each other across a triangular playing surface. Upon winning a battle, the winning creature can advance deeper into the ranks of the defending player's legion to strike at a new level of creatures.

One main feature of the game is that Chaotic cards all come with a unique code that the owner can use on a special website (www.chaoticgame.com) [closed as of 2018] to unlock a virtual version of that card. In this way, the player is provided with a virtual copy of their entire card collection. The other unique aspect is that the stats on each creature are random, so you may have multiple of the same card but unlikely that all stats are the same allowing for strategic advantages.

Galloping Ghosts was made by Lakeside for 2 or more players Ages 8 and up.

COMPLETE contents include: 1 revolving/spinning tray, 4 tablets, 4 colored pencils, and 4 ghost markers. 
Objective: To not complete any words during the game. Players must drop out of the game when they form their 5th word.

Each player writes the first letter of a word with his colored pencil on the tablet in his writing section. When all players have written their letter, the tray that moves the tablets is turned left in the direction of the arrows so the tablets move to the next position around the table.

Players add a letter to the new tablet in their writing section. The letters in sequence should be part of a legal word. Game play continues as players add a new letter each turn to each combination of letters on the tablets. Players CANNOT "pass" a turn at any time. Each player uses a different colored pencil, so a missing color on any tablet can easily be spotted and quickly identified

When a player is forced to complete a word he moves his ghost marker to the next letter on his "ghostboard". He then runs a line through the completed word on the tablet. The tray is turned and the next player starts a new word on the tablet (the rest of the letter groups stay as they are).

Players should always have a word in mind as they play because they may be challenged at any time.
Skirmish Wargame rules for 20th to early 21st century special forces operations and other small unit actions.

link.value: To The Last Man: Rules for WWI Skirmish Combat
HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)
